FractalAnalysis

class PVBM.FractalAnalysis.MultifractalVBMs(n_dim=10, n_rotations=25, optimize=True, min_proba=0.01, maxproba=0.98)[source]
A class which holds all required parameters and all the methods to perform

multifractal calculation on binary images.

Parameters:

  • n_dim (int) – maximum dimension used to calculate Singularity Length.

  • n_rotations (int) – number of rotations performed on the given image from which the optimal run will be chosen.

  • optimize (bool) – if True - an optimal run will be chosen from n_rotations runs, otherwise only 1 angle will be used.

  • min_proba (float) – a minimum probability for the occupancy of calculated boxes. Boxes with smaller probability will be ignored.

  • max_proba (float) – a maximum probability for the occupancy of calculated boxes. Boxes with higher probability will be ignored.

Example

tar = ‘example_arteries_586_LES_AV.png’ sample_arteries_image = skio.imread(tar) f_multi = FundusMultifractal() out1 = f_multi.get_fundus_biomarkers(sample_arteries_image) print(out1)

tar = ‘sierpinski.png’ example_monofractal_im = skio.imread(tar) / 255 f_multi = FundusMultifractal(n_rotations=10) out2 = f_multi.get_fundus_biomarkers(example_monofractal_im) print(out2)

tar = ‘binhen.tif’ example_multifractal_im = skio.imread(tar)/255 f_multi = FundusMultifractal(n_rotations=4) out3 = f_multi.get_fundus_biomarkers(example_multifractal_im) print(out3)

static custom_add_reduceat(image, idx, axis=0)[source]

Custom numpy.add.reduceat function, twice as fast in the context of binary images. Sum a 2d-image along a given axis, in the intervals specified by ‘idx’.

Parameters:

  • image (ndarray) – (N,N) numpy array.

  • idx (ndarray) – indices along the axis between which the function should sum the values.

  • axis (int) – Specifies the dimension of im on which to operate. Must be {0, 1}.

Returns:

Aggregated image along the given axis.

Return type:

ndarray with size (idx.shape[0], N) for axis=0 or (N, idx.shape[0]) for axis=1.

get_fundus_biomarkers(image)[source]

This method will be used to calculate the following dimensions: (D0, D1, D2, singularity length).

Parameters:

image (int) – (N,N) binary numpy array image.

Returns:

A numpy array containing the [D0, D1, D2, Singularity Length] features.

Return type:

ndarray

get_multi_fractal_dimension(image, q)[source]

Calculates Q dimension from the given binary image.

Parameters:

  • image (ndarray) – (N,N) binary numpy array image.

  • q (float) – q power of multi-fractal D_q which will be calculated from image.

Returns:

4-tuple of Multi-fractal calculations: * Dq_slope - D_q value for given q. * dq_r2 - R^2 of the fit of D_q. * fq_slope - f(q) value for given q. * alphaq_slope - lpha(q) value for given q.

get_q_fractals(image, rotations, dim_list)[source]

Calculates all multi-fractal dimensions specified in dim_list for rotation number of times.

Parameters:

  • image (ndarray) – (N,N) binary numpy array image.

  • rotations (int) – number of rotations performed on the given image from which the optimal run will be chosen.

  • dim_list – Iterable of dimensions to calculate from image.

Returns:

The output of ‘get_multi_fractal_dimension’ for every rotation and q dimension.

Return type:

ndarray with size (rotations, len(dim_list), 4).

get_singularity_length(alpha)[source]

Calculates singularity length from f(alpha) singularity curve.

Parameters:

alpha (int) – 1D numpy array containing f(alpha) singularity curve values.

Returns:

Singularity length of this f(alpha) curve.

Return type:

float
